resources.string: Airodump, aireplay and mdk will stop. Are you sure?
Hijacker is running in the background
WPA handshake captured. Saved in file

It is extremely illegal to use this application against networks for which you don\'t have permission. You can use it only on YOUR network or a network that you are authorized to. I am not responsible for how you use this application and any damages you may cause.\nConsider yourself warned.

This application is a Graphical User Interface for the wireless auditing tools airodump-ng, aireplay-ng, aircrack-ng and mdk3 and requires a Monitor Mode enabled WiFi interface. Only some android devices support this but none of them natively. You need to use a custom firmware (bcmon, Nexmon) so that your wireless adapter can be used in Monitor Mode. External adapters can also be used. You can configure your interface\'s name in Settings. This app requires root privileges to run the tools. If you don\'t grant them, it will hang. Don\'t ask me why…\nYou can install the tools and firmware (only nexmon) now, or you can go to the Home Screen and use the defaults.
The WiFi interface that is Monitor Mode enabled.
Command to enable monitor mode (leave blank if none)
Command to enable monitor mode specific to your interface. Will be run AS ROOT every time airodump-ng starts.
Command to disable monitor mode (leave blank if none)
Command to disable monitor mode specific to your interface. Will be run AS ROOT when the app is being killed.
A prefix for every command that is run and needs monitor mode. (LD_PRELOAD)

The directory to save the cap file when cracking WPA or WEP. This needs to be a directory that you have access to and won\'t be deleted (eg. not a tmp folder). It will be created and written to, and also a \"rm -rf …\" is ran in it as root so be careful what you enter here. Don\'t end it with /
Delete .csv and .netxml files created by airodump when cracking a network
Time to deauthenticate clients when cracking WPA
How long aireplay-ng --deauth will be run when cracking a WPA network before it stops to capture the handshake.
Time to wait when starting aireplay
If the -D option is not used with aireplay-ng (by default it is), then we need to wait for airodump-ng to lock a channel before we start aireplay-ng.
Show notification when the app is in the background
Show additional details about aireplay and mdk in notification
Print debugging messages to logcat. Messages about exceptions will be printed anyway.
Show a confirmation dialog when pressing back from the home screen
If aircrack-ng is not installed somewhere that PATH points to, you need to specify the absolute aircrack-ng filename here. Options can be used too. Make sure the file is executable.
If airodump-ng is not installed somewhere that PATH points to, you need to specify the absolute airodump-ng filename here. Options can be used too. Make sure the file is executable.
If aireplay-ng is not installed somewhere that PATH points to, you need to specify the absolute aireplay-ng filename here. Options can be used too. Make sure the file is executable.
If mdk3 is not installed somewhere that PATH points to, you need to specify the absolute mdk3 filename here. Options can be used too. Make sure the file is executable.
Run all the tools to make sure that the settings are correct. Any running tasks will be stopped.
Install the required tools (aircrack-ng suite, mdk3, wireless tools)
Install the Nexmon driver and its management utility (nexutil at /su/xbin)
There is no backup. It is created when you install the tools through the app.
